                    397
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    398
                    1x
                    
                      
  for (col in names(expected)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    399
                    2x
                    
                      
    exp_col <- expected[[col]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    400
                    2x
                    
                      
    act_col <- actual[[col]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    401
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    402
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (is.numeric(exp_col) && is.numeric(act_col)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    403
                    1x
                    
                      
      diffs <- which(abs(exp_col - act_col) > tolerance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    404
                    
                    
                      
    } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    405
                    1x
                    
                      
      diffs <- which(exp_col != act_col)

                    		
                  

                  

                    406
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    407
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    408
                    2x
                    
                      
    if (length(diffs) > 0 && diff_count < max_show) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    409
                    1x
                    
                      
      cat(sprintf("Column '%s': %d difference(s)\n", col, length(diffs)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    410
                    1x
                    
                      
      for (idx in head(diffs, 3)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    411
                    1x
                    
                      
        cat(sprintf("  Row %d: Expected %s, Got %s\n", 

                    		
                  

                  

                    412
                    1x
                    
                      
                    idx, format(exp_col[idx]), format(act_col[idx])))

                    		
                  

                  

                    413
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    414
                    1x
                    
                      
      diff_count <- diff_count + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    415
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    416
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    417
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    418
                    1x
                    
                      
  invisible(NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    419
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    420
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    421
                    
                    
                      
#' Show list differences

                    		
                  

                  

                    422
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    423
                    
                    
                      
show_list_diff <- function(expected, actual, max_show, tolerance) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    424
                    !
                    
                      
  if (length(expected) != length(actual)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    425
                    !
                    
                      
    cat(cli::col_yellow("Length mismatch:\n"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    426
                    !
                    
                      
    cat(sprintf("  Expected length: %d\n", length(expected)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    427
                    !
                    
                      
    cat(sprintf("  Actual length:   %d\n", length(actual)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    428
                    !
                    
                      
    return(invisible(NULL))

                    		
                  

                  

                    429
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    430
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    431
                    
                    
                      
  # Check each element

                    		
                  

                  

                    432
                    !
                    
                      
  diff_count <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    433
                    !
                    
                      
  for (i in seq_along(expected)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    434
                    !
                    
                      
    if (!.cpp_compare_fast(expected[[i]], actual[[i]], tolerance)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    435
                    !
                    
                      
      diff_count <- diff_count + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    436
                    !
                    
                      
      if (diff_count <= max_show) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    437
                    !
                    
                      
        name <- if (!is.null(names(expected))) names(expected)[i] else i

                    		
                  

                  

                    438
                    !
                    
                      
        cat(sprintf("Element [[%s]]:\n", name))

                    		
                  

                  

                    439
                    !
                    
                      
        cat(sprintf("  Expected: %s\n", format_output(expected[[i]])))

                    		
                  

                  

                    440
                    !
                    
                      
        cat(sprintf("  Actual:   %s\n\n", format_output(actual[[i]])))

                    		
                  

                  

                    441
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    442
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    443
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    444
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    445
                    !
                    
                      
  if (diff_count > max_show) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    446
                    !
                    
                      
    cat(cli::col_grey(sprintf("... (%d more differences)\n", diff_count - max_show)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    447
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    448
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    449
                    !
                    
                      
  invisible(NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    450
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    451
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    452
                    
                    
                      
# ============================================================================

                    		
                  

                  

                    453
                    
                    
                      
# WALDO-BASED DIFF (Enhanced diff when waldo package is available)

                    		
                  

                  

                    454
                    
                    
                      
# ============================================================================

                    		
                  

                  

                    455
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    456
                    
                    
                      
#' Show differences using waldo package

                    		
                  

                  

                    457
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    458
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    459
                    
                    
                      
#' Uses the waldo package for rich, colorful diff output when available.

                    		
                  

                  

                    460
                    
                    
                      
#' Falls back gracefully if waldo is not installed.

                    		
                  

                  

                    461
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    462
                    
                    
                      
#' @param expected The expected value

                    		
                  

                  

                    463
                    
                    
                      
#' @param actual The actual value from student code

                    		
                  

                  

                    464
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tolerance Numeric tolerance for comparisons

                    		
                  

                  

                    465
                    
                    
                      
#' @param max_diffs Maximum number of differences to show

                    		
                  

                  

                    466
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    467
                    
                    
                      
#' @return TRUE if diff was shown, NULL if waldo produced no output

                    		
                  

                  

                    468
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    469
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    470
                    
                    
                      
show_waldo_diff <- function(expected, actual, tolerance = 1e-10, max_diffs = 10) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    471
                    1x
                    
                      
  if (!requireNamespace("waldo", quietly = TRUE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    472
                    !
                    
                      
    return(NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    473
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    474
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    475
                    
                    
                      
  # Use waldo::compare for rich diff output

                    		
                  

                  

                    476
                    1x
                    
                      
  diff_output <- tryCatch({

                    		
                  

                  

                    477
                    1x
                    
                      
    waldo::compare(

                    		
                  

                  

                    478
                    1x
                    
                      
      expected, actual,

                    		
                  

                  

                    479
                    1x
                    
                      
      x_arg = "expected",

                    		
                  

                  

                    480
                    1x
                    
                      
      y_arg = "your_output",

                    		
                  

                  

                    481
                    1x
                    
                      
      tolerance = tolerance,

                    		
                  

                  

                    482
                    1x
                    
                      
      max_diffs = max_diffs

                    		
                  

                  

                    483
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    484
                    1x
                    
                      
  }, error = function(e) NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    485
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    486
                    1x
                    
                      
  if (is.null(diff_output) || length(diff_output) == 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    487
                    !
                    
                      
    return(NULL)

                    		
                  

                  

                    488
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    489
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    490
                    
                    
                      
  # Print waldo output with styling

                    		
                  

                  

                    491
                    1x
                    
                      
  cat(cli::col_cyan("Differences (via waldo):\n\n"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    492
                    1x
                    
                      
  for (line in diff_output) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    493
                    1x
                    
                      
    cat(line, "\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    494
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    495
                    1x
                    
                      
  cat("\n")

                    		
                  

                  

                    496
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    497
                    1x
                    
                      
  invisible(TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    498
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    499
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    500
                    
                    
                      
#' Compare objects with waldo

                    		
                  

                  

                    501
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    502
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    503
                    
                    
                      
#' Uses waldo::compare to check if two objects are equal, with rich diff output.

                    		
                  

                  

                    504
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    505
                    
                    
                      
#' @param expected The expected value

                    		
                  

                  

                    506
                    
                    
                      
#' @param actual The actual value

                    		
                  

                  

                    507
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tolerance Numeric tolerance

                    		
                  

                  

                    508
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    509
                    
                    
                      
#' @return Logical indicating if objects are equal

                    		
                  

                  

                    510
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    511
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    512
                    
                    
                      
compare_with_waldo <- function(expected, actual, tolerance = 1e-10) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    513
                    !
                    
                      
  if (!requireNamespace("waldo", quietly = TRUE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    514
                    
                    
                      
    # Fall back to internal comparison

                    		
                  

                  

                    515
                    !
                    
                      
    return(.cpp_compare_fast(expected, actual, tolerance))

                    		
                  

                  

                    516
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    517
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    518
                    !
                    
                      
  diff <- waldo::compare(expected, actual, tolerance = tolerance)

                    		
                  

                  

                    519
                    !
                    
                      
  length(diff) == 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    520
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
# ============================================================================

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
# AUTOGRADER PACKAGE - TEST EXECUTION

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
# ============================================================================

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
# File: execution.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
# Purpose: Sequential and parallel test execution

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
# Performance Optimization for Large Test Sets

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
# Decision Tree:

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#   - < 10 tests: Use sequential (overhead not worth it)

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#   - ≥ 10 tests AND use_parallel=TRUE: Use parallel

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#   - use_parallel=FALSE: Always use sequential

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
# Parallel Benefits:

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#   - Tests run independently (embarassingly parallel)

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#   - Speedup: ~2-4x on multi-core systems

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#   - No shared state = no synchronization overhead

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
# Parallel Overhead:

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#   - Cluster setup: ~100-200ms

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#   - Data serialization: ~10ms per test

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#   - Worth it for: 10+ tests

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#   - Not worth it for: <10 tests

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
# Implementation Notes:

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#   - Uses snow-style cluster (portable across OS)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#   - Limits cores to min(available-1, 4) to keep system responsive

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#   - Exports necessary objects explicitly

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#   - Proper cleanup with on.exit()

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
# ============================================================================

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#' Run tests in parallel using multiple CPU cores

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' Executes test cases in parallel for improved performance on multi-core

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
#' systems. Automatically falls back to sequential for small test sets.

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#' Parallel Execution Strategy:

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Create cluster with n cores (leave 1 free for system)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Export student_fun, instructor_fun, tolerance to workers

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Distribute test indices across workers

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Each worker: runs test, catches errors, returns result

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Main process: collects results, cleans up cluster

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#' @param student_fun Student's function implementation

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' @param instructor_fun Instructor's reference implementation

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#' @param test_data Validated test case data

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tolerance Numeric tolerance for comparisons

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#' @param use_parallel Whether to actually use parallel (TRUE) or fall back (FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data_cache Named list of loaded data objects (optional)

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List of test results, each containing:

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    
                    
                      
#'   - student: student output or error object

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    
                    
                      
#'   - expected: expected output or error object

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
#'   - index: test number (1-based)

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    
                    
                      
#' Performance Characteristics:

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Setup cost: ~100-200ms (cluster creation)

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Per-test overhead: ~10ms (serialization)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Speedup: typically 2-4x on 4-core system

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Worth it for: ≥10 tests

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
#' Core Allocation Strategy:

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Detect available cores

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Use cores - 1 (keep system responsive)

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Cap at 4 cores (diminishing returns beyond this)

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Example: 8-core system → use 4 cores

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    
                    
                      
#' @section Resource Management:

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    
                    
                      
#'   Cluster is always stopped via on.exit(), even if errors occur.

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
#'   This prevents orphaned R processes.

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
run_tests_parallel <- function(student_fun, instructor_fun, test_data, tolerance, use_parallel = TRUE, data_cache = list()) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    3x
                    
                      
  n_tests <- length(test_data$inputs)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
  # ===== DECISION: Use parallel or not? =====

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
  # Parallel has overhead; only worth it for many tests

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    3x
                    
                      
  if (!use_parallel || n_tests < 10) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    2x
                    
                      
    return(run_tests_sequential(student_fun, instructor_fun, test_data, tolerance, data_cache))

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
  # ===== SETUP PARALLEL CLUSTER =====

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
  # Determine optimal number of cores

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
  # Strategy: use available-1, capped at 4

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    1x
                    
                      
  n_cores <- min(

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    1x
                    
                      
    parallel::detectCores() - 1,  # Leave one core for system

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    1x
                    
                      
    4                              # Cap at 4 (diminishing returns)

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
  # Create cluster (starts background R processes)

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    1x
                    
                      
  cl <- parallel::makeCluster(n_cores)

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
  # Ensure cluster is stopped even if error occurs

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    1x
                    
                      
  on.exit(parallel::stopCluster(cl), add = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
  # Get timeout from options

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    1x
                    
                      
  timeout <- getOption("autograder.test_timeout", 30)

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
  # Export necessary objects to worker processes

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
  # Workers are independent R processes with empty environments

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
  # Must explicitly export anything they need

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    1x
                    
                      
  parallel::clusterExport(

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    1x
                    
                      
    cl, 

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    1x
                    
                      
    c("student_fun", "instructor_fun", "tolerance", "data_cache", 

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    1x
                    
                      
      "inject_data_into_inputs", "timeout"),

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    1x
                    
                      
    envir = environment()

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
  # ===== RUN TESTS IN PARALLEL =====

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    
                    
                      
  # parLapply distributes indices across workers

                    		
                  

                  

                    116
                    
                    
                      
  # Each worker processes a subset of test indices

                    		
                  

                  

                    117
                    1x
                    
                      
  results <- parallel::parLapply(cl, seq_along(test_data$inputs), function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    118
                    15x
                    
                      
    input_args <- test_data$inputs[[i]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    119
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    120
                    
                    
                      
    # Inject data if needed

                    		
                  

                  

                    121
                    15x
                    
                      
    if (length(data_cache) > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    122
                    !
                    
                      
      input_args <- inject_data_into_inputs(input_args, data_cache)

                    		
                  

                  

                    123
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    124
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    125
                    
                    
                      
    # Run student function with error catching and timeout

                    		
                  

                  

                    126
                    15x
                    
                      
    student_out <- tryCatch({

                    		
                  

                  

                    127
                    15x
                    
                      
      setTimeLimit(cpu = timeout, elapsed = timeout, transient = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    128
                    15x
                    
                      
      on.exit(setTimeLimit(cpu = Inf, elapsed = Inf, transient = FALSE), add = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    129
                    15x
                    
                      
      do.call(student_fun, input_args)

                    		
                  

                  

                    130
                    15x
                    
                      
    }, error = function(e) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    131
                    5x
                    
                      
      if (grepl("time limit|reached elapsed|reached CPU", e$message, ignore.case = TRUE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    132
                    !
                    
                      
        structure(list(error = sprintf("Timeout: exceeded %d seconds", timeout)), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    133
                    !
                    
                      
                  class = c("timeout_error", "error"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    134
                    
                    
                      
      } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    135
                    5x
                    
                      
        structure(list(error = e$message), class = "error")

                    		
                  

                  

                    136
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    137
                    
                    
                      
    })

                    		
                  

                  

                    138
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    139
                    
                    
                      
    # Run instructor function with error catching

                    		
                  

                  

                    140
                    
                    
                      
    # If instructor function errors, it's a config problem

                    		
                  

                  

                    141
                    15x
                    
                      
    expected_out <- tryCatch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    142
                    15x
                    
                      
      do.call(instructor_fun, input_args),

                    		
                  

                  

                    143
                    15x
                    
                      
      error = function(e) structure(list(error = e$message), class = "error")

                    		
                  

                  

                    144
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    145
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    146
                    
                    
                      
    # Return structured result

                    		
                  

                  

                    147
                    15x
                    
                      
    list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    148
                    15x
                    
                      
      student = student_out,

                    		
                  

                  

                    149
                    15x
                    
                      
      expected = expected_out,

                    		
                  

                  

                    150
                    15x
                    
                      
      index = i

                    		
                  

                  

                    151
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    152
                    
                    
                      
  })

                    		
                  

                  

                    153
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    154
                    
                    
                      
  # Cluster is automatically stopped by on.exit()

                    		
                  

                  

                    155
                    1x
                    
                      
  results

                    		
                  

                  

                    156
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    157
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    158
                    
                    
                      
#' Run tests sequentially (one after another)

                    		
                  

                  

                    159
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    160
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    161
                    
                    
                      
#' Executes test cases one at a time in order. Used for:

                    		
                  

                  

                    162
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Small test sets (<10 tests)

                    		
                  

                  

                    163
                    
                    
                      
#'   - When use_parallel = FALSE

                    		
                  

                  

                    164
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Debugging (easier to trace)

                    		
                  

                  

                    165
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    166
                    
                    
                      
#' Advantages over Parallel:

                    		
                  

                  

                    167
                    
                    
                      
#'   - No setup overhead

                    		
                  

                  

                    168
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Easier debugging (linear execution)

                    		
                  

                  

                    169
                    
                    
                      
#'   - More predictable

                    		
                  

                  

                    170
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Better for small test sets

                    		
                  

                  

                    171
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    172
                    
                    
                      
#' @param student_fun Student's function

                    		
                  

                  

                    173
                    
                    
                      
#' @param instructor_fun Instructor's reference function

                    		
                  

                  

                    174
                    
                    
                      
#' @param test_data Validated test case data

                    		
                  

                  

                    175
                    
                    
                      
#' @param tolerance Numeric tolerance

                    		
                  

                  

                    176
                    
                    
                      
#' @param data_cache Named list of loaded data objects (optional)

                    		
                  

                  

                    177
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    178
                    
                    
                      
#' @return List of test results (same structure as parallel version)

                    		
                  

                  

                    179
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    180
                    
                    
                      
#' @details

                    		
                  

                  

                    181
                    
                    
                      
#' Execution Flow:

                    		
                  

                  

                    182
                    
                    
                      
#'   For each test:

                    		
                  

                  

                    183
                    
                    
                      
#'     1. Extract input arguments

                    		
                  

                  

                    184
                    
                    
                      
#'     2. Inject data if needed

                    		
                  

                  

                    185
                    
                    
                      
#'     3. Call student function (catch errors)

                    		
                  

                  

                    186
                    
                    
                      
#'     4. Call instructor function (catch errors)

                    		
                  

                  

                    187
                    
                    
                      
#'     5. Package results

                    		
                  

                  

                    188
                    
                    
                      
#'     6. Move to next test

                    		
                  

                  

                    189
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    190
                    
                    
                      
#' Error Handling:

                    		
                  

                  

                    191
                    
                    
                      
#'   Errors are captured, not thrown. This allows:

                    		
                  

                  

                    192
                    
                    
                      
#'   - All tests to run (one failure doesn't stop others)

                    		
                  

                  

                    193
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Detailed error reporting for each test

                    		
                  

                  

                    194
                    
                    
                      
#'   - Graceful handling of student code errors

                    		
                  

                  

                    195
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    196
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    197
                    
                    
                      
run_tests_sequential <- function(student_fun, instructor_fun, test_data, tolerance, data_cache = list()) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    198
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    199
                    
                    
                      
  # Get timeout from options (default: 30 seconds per test)

                    		
                  

                  

                    200
                    8x
                    
                      
  timeout <- getOption("autograder.test_timeout", 30)

                    		
                  

                  

                    201
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    202
                    
                    
                      
  # Simple lapply - process tests one by one

                    		
                  

                  

                    203
                    8x
                    
                      
  results <- lapply(seq_along(test_data$inputs), function(i) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    204
                    36x
                    
                      
    input_args <- test_data$inputs[[i]]

                    		
                  

                  

                    205
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    206
                    
                    
                      
    # ===== INJECT DATA IF NEEDED =====

                    		
                  

                  

                    207
                    
                    
                      
    # Replace data file references with actual loaded data

                    		
                  

                  

                    208
                    36x
                    
                      
    if (length(data_cache) > 0) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    209
                    !
                    
                      
      input_args <- inject_data_into_inputs(input_args, data_cache)

                    		
                  

                  

                    210
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    211
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    212
                    
                    
                      
    # ===== RUN STUDENT FUNCTION WITH TIMEOUT =====

                    		
                  

                  

                    213
                    
                    
                      
    # Wrap in tryCatch with timeout to prevent infinite loops

                    		
                  

                  

                    214
                    36x
                    
                      
    student_out <- tryCatch({

                    		
                  

                  

                    215
                    36x
                    
                      
      setTimeLimit(cpu = timeout, elapsed = timeout, transient = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    216
                    36x
                    
                      
      on.exit(setTimeLimit(cpu = Inf, elapsed = Inf, transient = FALSE), add = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    217
                    36x
                    
                      
      do.call(student_fun, input_args)

                    		
                  

                  

                    218
                    36x
                    
                      
    }, error = function(e) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    219
                    
                    
                      
      # Check for timeout error

                    		
                  

                  

                    220
                    2x
                    
                      
      if (grepl("time limit|reached elapsed|reached CPU", e$message, ignore.case = TRUE)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    221
                    !
                    
                      
        structure(list(error = sprintf("Timeout: exceeded %d seconds", timeout)), 

                    		
                  

                  

                    222
                    !
                    
                      
                  class = c("timeout_error", "error"))

                    		
                  

                  

                    223
                    
                    
                      
      } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    224
                    2x
                    
                      
        structure(list(error = e$message), class = "error")

                    		
                  

                  

                    225
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    226
                    
                    
                      
    })

                    		
                  

                  

                    227
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    228
                    
                    
                      
    # ===== RUN INSTRUCTOR FUNCTION =====

                    		
                  

                  

                    229
                    
                    
                      
    # Should never error (instructor code should be tested)

                    		
                  

                  

                    230
                    
                    
                      
    # But catch anyway for robustness

                    		
                  

                  

                    231
                    36x
                    
                      
    expected_out <- tryCatch(

                    		
                  

                  

                    232
                    36x
                    
                      
      do.call(instructor_fun, input_args),

                    		
                  

                  

                    233
                    36x
                    
                      
      error = function(e) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    234
                    2x
                    
                      
        structure(list(error = e$message), class = "error")

                    		
                  

                  

                    235
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    236
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    237
                    
                    
                      
    

                    		
                  

                  

                    238
                    
                    
                      
    # ===== PACKAGE RESULTS =====

                    		
                  

                  

                    239
                    
                    
                      
    # Return list with outputs and index

                    		
                  

                  

                    240
                    
                    
                      
    # Index is needed for matching with test metadata later

                    		
                  

                  

                    241
                    36x
                    
                      
    list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    242
                    36x
                    
                      
      student = student_out,

                    		
                  

                  

                    243
                    36x
                    
                      
      expected = expected_out,

                    		
                  

                  

                    244
                    36x
                    
                      
      index = i

                    		
                  

                  

                    245
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    246
                    
                    
                      
  })

                    		
                  

                  

                    247
                    
                    
                      
  

                    		
                  

                  

                    248
                    8x
                    
                      
  results

                    		
                  

                  

                    249
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
# ============================================================================

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
# AUTOGRADER PACKAGE - MAIN AUTOGRADER FUNCTION

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
# ============================================================================

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
# File: autograder-main.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
# Purpose: Primary user-facing autograder function

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
# This is the main function students use to test their implementations.

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
# It orchestrates the entire grading workflow.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
# Related Files:

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#   - errors.R: Custom error classes

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#   - utils.R: Helper functions (format_output, %||%)

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#   - validation.R: Test case validation

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#   - fetch.R: Instructor code fetching

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#   - feedback.R: Student feedback generation

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#   - execution.R: Test execution (parallel/sequential)

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#   - api.R: Discovery functions (list_problems, preview_tests)

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#   - performance.R: Performance comparison

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#   - zzz.R: Package startup

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
# Design Philosophy:

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#   - User-friendly: Clear error messages, helpful feedback

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#   - Robust: Handles all error cases gracefully

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#   - Performant: Uses parallel execution for large test sets

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#   - Informative: Provides detailed feedback to guide learning

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
# Workflow Summary:

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#   1. Validate all input parameters

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#   2. Check prerequisites (internet, student function)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#   3. Fetch instructor code and test cases

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#   4. Run tests (parallel or sequential)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#   5. Compare outputs and generate feedback

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#   6. Display results and summary

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#   7. Return structured results object

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
# ============================================================================

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
#' Run autograder by function name

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
#' @description

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
#' Tests student implementation against reference outputs with support for

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
#' points, descriptions, hidden tests, type checking, tolerance, parallel

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
#' execution, and detailed feedback.

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
#' 

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
#' This is the main function students use to test their work.

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
#' @param function_name Character. Name of the function to test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
#'        Must match a function in the repository (see list_problems()).

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      
#'        Example: "fibonacci", "factorial", "sum_vector"

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    
                    
                      
#'        

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    
                    
                      
#' @param verbose Logical. Show detailed output for each test? 

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
